edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.fitting

Class ImageObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.fitting.ImageObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CentroidImageObject, GaussianImageObject, GaussianImageObjectWithCovariance

    public abstract class ImageObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    An object in an image with some spatial extent that can be fit to some function. Classes that extend ImageObject will supply methods that perform the fit to a specific functional form.
    Author:
    Colin J. Fuller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected void init()
        Initializes the fields of an ImageObject to default or null values.

      • init

        protected void init(int label,
        Image mask,
        Image parent,
        ParameterDictionary p)
        Initializes the fields of an ImageObject based on supplied image and parameter data. Both the mask and the parent will be unmodified, except for boxing a region of interest, so no other thread should be using these images at the same time.
        Parameters:
        label - The numerical label of the object in the mask.
        mask - An image mask, containing a unique greylevel for each object; the greylevel of the object being initialized should correspond to the parameter label.
        parent - The original imgae that the mask corresponds to.
        p - A ParameterDictionary containing the parameters for the current analysis. In particular, this routine makes use of the various box size parameters.

      • fitPosition

        public abstract void fitPosition(ParameterDictionary p)
        Fits the object to the ImageObject's functional form in order to determine its position.
        Parameters:
        p - The parameters for the current analysis.

      • getFitParametersByChannel

        public java.util.List<FitParameters> getFitParametersByChannel()
        Gets the fitted parameters, one set per channel in the original image of the object.
        Returns:
        A List containing FitParameters objects, one for each channel in the original object.

      • getImageID

        public java.lang.String getImageID()
        Gets the ID of the image from which the object was taken (this could, for instance, be the filename of the original image).
        Returns:
        A string that is the ID of the original image.

      • setImageID

        public void setImageID(java.lang.String imageID)
        Sets the ID of the image from which the object was taken (this could, for instance, be the filename of the original image).
        Parameters:
        imageID - A string to which to set the ID of the image.

      • nullifyImages

        public void nullifyImages()
        Nullifies the references to the parent and mask image, and the internal storage of the image data and coordinates to free them for garbage collection. This should only be called after fitting has been completed, as fitting will no longer be possible without the original image data.

      • getMask

        public Image getMask()
        Returns a reference to the mask of the original image that was used to create this ImageObject.
        Returns:
        A reference to the mask Image.

      • getParent

        public Image getParent()
        Returns a reference to the parent Image of this ImageObject (that is, the image used to create it).
        Returns:
        A reference to the parent Image.

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Cleans up the ImageCoordinates used internally by ImageCoordinates and recycles them for future use.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • boxImages

        public void boxImages()
        Sets the relevant region of interest in the parent image to be the region that boxes this object.

      • unboxImages

        public void unboxImages()
        Clears the region of interest in the parent image.

      • getxValues

        public double[] getxValues()
        Gets the internal array containing the x-coordinates of the pixels in the box containing this object. No specific order is guaranteed beyond that it must be the same order as the y- and z- coordinates and function values.
        Returns:
        An array containing the x-coordinates of each pixel in this object's box.

      • getyValues

        public double[] getyValues()
        Gets the internal array containing the y-coordinates of the pixels in the box containing this object. No specific order is guaranteed beyond that it must be the same order as the x- and z- coordinates and function values.
        Returns:
        An array containing the x-coordinates of each pixel in this object's box.

      • getzValues

        public double[] getzValues()
        Gets the internal array containing the z-coordinates of the pixels in the box containing this object. No specific order is guaranteed beyond that it must be the same order as the x- and y- coordinates and function values.
        Returns:
        An array containing the x-coordinates of each pixel in this object's box.

      • getFunctionValues

        public double[] getFunctionValues()
        Gets the internal array containing the greylevel values of the pixels in the box containing this object. No specific order is guaranteed beyond that it must be the same order as the x-, y-, and z- coordinates.
        Returns:
        An array containing the values of each pixel in this object's box.

      • finishedFitting

        public boolean finishedFitting()
        Gets information on whether this object has finished fitting with no errors.
        Returns:
        true if fitting finished normally, false if there was an error or the object was not yet fit.

      • getCorrectionSuccessful

        public boolean getCorrectionSuccessful()
        Gets information on whether this ImageObject had its position corrected successfully.
        Returns:
        true if the position was corrected successfully, false if it failed or was not corrected at all.

      • setCorrectionSuccessful

        public void setCorrectionSuccessful(boolean success)
        Sets whether this ImageObject had its position corrected successfully.
        Parameters:
        success - Whether the position has been corrected successfully.

      • getFitR2ByChannel

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getFitR2ByChannel()
        Gets the R^2 values for the fit in each channel.
        Returns:
        a List containing one R^2 value for the fit in each channel.

      • getFitErrorByChannel

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getFitErrorByChannel()
        Gets an error estimate for the fitting of the position of the object in each channel.
        Returns:
        a List containing one fit error estimate for each channel.

      • getNPhotonsByChannel

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getNPhotonsByChannel()
        Gets the number of photons above background from the object in each channel.
        Returns:
        a List containing the number of photons collected in each channel.

      • getLabel

        public int getLabel()
        Gets the label of this object; this corresponds to its greylevel value in the original image mask.
        Returns:
        The label of this object.

      • getPositionForChannel

        public org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector getPositionForChannel(int channel)
        Gets the position of this object in the specified channel. Do not modify the returned RealVector, as it is a reference to the internally stored vector.
        Parameters:
        channel - The index of the channel, either by order in the original multiwavelength image, or in the order specified for split wavelength images.
        Returns:
        A RealVector containing the x,y,and z coordinates of the position, or null if it has not yet been determined, or the channel is out of range.

      • getCorrectedPositionForChannel

        public org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector getCorrectedPositionForChannel(int channel)
        Gets the corrected position of this object in the specified channel (if there is a corrected position). Do not modify the returned RealVector, as it is a reference to the internally stored vector.
        Parameters:
        channel - The index of the channel, either by order in the original multiwavelength image, or in the order specified for split wavelength images.
        Returns:
        A RealVector containing the x,y,and z coordinates of the position, or null if it has not yet been determined, or the channel is out of range.

      • applyCorrectionVectorToChannel

        public void applyCorrectionVectorToChannel(int channel,
                                  org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector correction)
        Applies the specified correction vector to the position of the object to generate a corrected position that can be accessed using getCorrectedPositionForChannel(int).
        Parameters:
        channel - The index of the channel, either by order in the original multiwavelength image, or in the order specified for split wavelength images.
        correction - a RealVector containing a correction that will be subtracted from the position of the object in the specified channel.

      • getVectorDifferenceBetweenChannels

        public org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector getVectorDifferenceBetweenChannels(int channel0,
                                                                            int channel1)
        Gets the vector difference between the position of the object in two channels. Note that there is no unit conversion here, and the distance is returned in image units of pixels or sections.
        Parameters:
        channel0 - The index of one channel to use for the difference.
        channel1 - The index of the other channel to use for the difference.
        Returns:
        The vector difference between the two channels, as channel1 - channel0, or null if either channel is out of range or has not yet been fit.

      • getCorrectedVectorDifferenceBetweenChannels

        public org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector getCorrectedVectorDifferenceBetweenChannels(int channel0,
                                                                                     int channel1)
        Gets the vector difference between the corrected positions of the object in two channels. If there is no corrected position for a channel, its uncorrected position is used. Note that there is no unit conversion here, and the distance is returned in image units of pixels or sections.
        Parameters:
        channel0 - The index of one channel to use for the difference.
        channel1 - The index of the other channel to use for the difference.
        Returns:
        The vector difference between the two channels, as channel1 - channel0, or null if either channel is out of range or has not yet been fit.

      • getScalarDifferenceBetweenChannels

        public java.lang.Double getScalarDifferenceBetweenChannels(int channel0,
                                                  int channel1,
                                                  org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector pixelToDistanceConversions)
        Gets the scalar difference between the position of the object in two channels. Units are converted from image units to real units using the supplied vector of conversions.
        Parameters:
        channel0 - The index of one channel to use for the difference.
        channel1 - The index of the other channel to use for the difference.
        pixelToDistanceConversions - A vector containing the number of realspace distance units per pixel or section, one element per dimension.
        Returns:
        The scalar distance between the position of the object in each channel (that is, the length of the vector representing the vector distance), or null if either channel is out of range or has not yet been fit.

      • writeToXMLString

        public java.lang.String writeToXMLString()

      • writeToXML

        public void writeToXML(javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamWriter xsw)
